definition:
Let $S$ be a set, and let $\{x_i\},\ i=0,1,2,\dots$ and
$\{y_i\},\ i=0,1,2,\dots$ be two sequences in $S$. The [*interleave
sequence*]{} is defined to be the sequence $x_0, y_0, x_1, y_1, \dots$.
Formally, it is the sequence $\{z_i\},\ i=0,1,2,\dots$ given by $$z_i :=
\begin{cases}
x_k & \text{\ \ if } i=2k \text{ is even,}\\
y_k & \text{\ \ if } i=2k+1 \text{ is odd.}
\end{cases}$$
